wikipedia_page.main: Peter Andrews (10 November 1845 – 24 July 1916) was a Scottish footballer, who played for Glasgow Eastern, Sheffield Heeley and Scotland. It is thought that Andrews was the first Scottish player to move to England to play football, although he moved for reasons of work rather than football itself as professionalism had not yet been established. Andrews played once for a Sheffield representative team against Manchester, and for both teams in the Sheffield v Glasgow series.

response: * 10 November – Peter Andrews (d. 1916), Scotland international in 1875 who may have been the first Scottish footballer to play in England.

Their best player was Jack Hunter who played seven times for EnglandClub Affiliations – Sheffield Heeley and captained them once. They also had Peter Andrews, a Scottish International who played against England in 1875. Jack Hudson started his career at Heeley before joining Sheffield and then The Wednesday, and made one appearance for England.
* Peter Andrews (cinematographer), a pseudonym used by American film director Steven Soderbergh (born 1963) when serving as his own Director of Photography

During its relatively short time, Eastern provided Scotland with some of its early international players, with John Hunter, Peter Andrews and Sandy Kennedy representing Scotland on a number of occasions.
